DataElement.preferredDefinition: User-defined description of the radiotherapy treatment plan.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A document outlining the essential treatment issues which will be addressed. This may include the problem to be addressed, the proposed treatment, the treatment goal, the time frame to meet goals, and an estimate of the costs._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A document outlining the essential treatment issues which will be addressed. This may include the problem to be addressed, the proposed treatment, the treatment goal, the time frame to meet goals, and an estimate of the costs.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

A document outlining the essential treatment issues which will be addressed. This may include the problem to be addressed, the proposed treatment, the treatment goal, the time frame to meet goals, and an estimate of the costs.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: ST:  DICOM Short Text; A character string that may contain one or more paragraphs. It may contain the Graphic Character set and the Control Characters, CR, LF, FF, and ESC. Data Elements with this DICOM Value Representation shall not be multi-valued

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/21/07 - released for curation of NCIA DEs. 5/31/07-Create for CDEs using the DICOM Date format; based on 2007 DICOM Standard, section 3.
